messages: a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (00:06): how do I copy-paste between documents
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (00:08): worked ito ut
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (00:16): What's the option that automatically handles brackets
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (00:16): like auto-indents curlybraces
a4892d487aa520c76d2bfa7fc4610b0a (00:18): oh it's on
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:42): Hello everyone
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:42): How can I get vim to accept my backspace key (^H)?
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:42): IE. If I am in insert mode - I can insert text - and then delete that
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:42): But I want to be able to delete any text in the file
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:43): I've read this help file
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:43): So - if I run :set backspace=2 at load of file - that should work right?
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:44): But it still only backspaces in insert mode
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:44): backspace when in normal mode moves backwards, as <Left> or h would
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:44): LeoNerd: Should I run that before or after I go into insert mode
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:44): I guess you have to do it before
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:44): Just stick it in your .vimrc, I guess you'll want it applied all the time?
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:45): This is a public machine
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:45): I don't have access to .vimrc
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:45): Its a comp lab
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:45): Not even for your own user account?
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:45): I donno - hmm
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:45): Where is that file located?
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:45): Do you have your own $HOME directory?
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:46): ok - let me look
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (00:46): you have to create it
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (00:46): it's not created by Vim
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:46): There may not be one there - if not, create it
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:47): Lets see
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:47): I have a home directory - there is nothing in there
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:47): Well, create that file then.
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:47): Well - the home directory has a subdir with all the domain's user accounts

f6308808391cc8c7e217116fd282ea1a (00:47): Hi all, I'm still having problem with a vim mapping: :map <Leader>ll :w<CR><Leader>ll doesn't work, i.e. it doesn't execute the :w part (perhaps the map doesn't affect anything at all)
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:48): LeoNerd: What should I name it?
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:48): Nothing .vimirc?
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:49): LeoNerd: With just that command/
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:49): Yup. Just one line is needed. And it doesn't need the leading ":"
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:50): I don't think I can write to that directory
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:51): it said cant open file for writing
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:52): let me try it another way
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:52): vim $HOME/.vimrc
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:52): I can't get there
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:52): And this dir is read only for me
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:52): Heh.. you can't write your own $HOME? Crazy system
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:53): gavrila1: what is that map supposed to do? why does it call itself?
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:53): I don't have my own $HOME
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:53): Err - if I do - I can't see it
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:53): Oh - ok - yeah - they changed the dir name
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:54): strange
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:54): its f85/<user> now...
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:55): LeoNerd: Thanks - working fine now
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:55): Alright - back to C programming! (My most favorite thing in the whole world
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:55): At least I can use vim over emacs now
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:56): emac's GUI was awful
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:56): err - is awful
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:56): Hrm.. idle wonderance... Why is <Backspace> in normal mode just the same as <Left> or h ? That doesn't sound useful
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:56): Why three keys to do the same thing?
f6308808391cc8c7e217116fd282ea1a (00:56): tpope because I want it to execute the same command as before, but saving the file before doing it
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:57): LeoNerd: How do you get that italic text in here?
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:57): Maybe its my irc client's problem
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:57): ChatZilla
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:57): Sounds client-based
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:57): I just typed text between backslashes
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:57): This text is *between* *astericks*, and this is /between/ /backslashes
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (00:57): Maybe your client does odd things for that
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (00:57): and _underscores_
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:58): Hey there we go
ded01cf47cdca62f9adcfd25cb1b3127 (00:58): *fail*
878b627b013f0c465ec2be26325ce80d (00:58): gavrila1: why not just set 'autowrite'?
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (00:58): It doesn't like the backslash thing :'(
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:59): gavrila1: you can't just remap like that. also, the old map is probably buffer local with higher precedence
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (00:59): and jamessan is right
f6308808391cc8c7e217116fd282ea1a (01:00): ok then I'll try that way
f6308808391cc8c7e217116fd282ea1a (01:00): will autowrite actually write before <Leader>ll ?
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (01:00): gavrila1: try :noremap
f6308808391cc8c7e217116fd282ea1a (01:01): LeoNerd I try
f6308808391cc8c7e217116fd282ea1a (01:02): LeoNerd :noremap no good :(
f6308808391cc8c7e217116fd282ea1a (01:03): autowrite works, thanks
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (01:06): no, noremap won't work either.  see :help maparg() for a more general solution
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (01:06): but all you really need is autowrite in this case
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (01:08): everything in 'runtimepath' + /doc
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (01:10): yeah but you don't usually keep documentation there
